lexUnit.name: nostril.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: either of two external openings of the nasal cavity in vertebrates that admit air to the lungs and smells to the olfactory nerves.

sentence.text: The thin hooked bill , with its external nostrils in tubes on the upper mandible , remind you that shear waters are members of the strange ` tube-nose " petrel family .
He took the perfume , and sprayed into the nostrils of both stallions .
Then she injects them into the nostrils of an unfortunate sheep where they quickly start feeding on the membranes lining their host 's sinuses .
The nostrils of a fish are not involved in any way with breathing but are U-shaped tubes that contain receptor cells capable of sensing the taste of water .
Jezrael inhaled freshness , trying to rid her nostrils of that cloying , heavy scent .

Miguelito , on the other hand , had gained face the closer the men came to action -- perhaps because he so obviously enjoyed killing , Trent thought as he watched Miguelito thumbnail more cocaine into his nostrils .
The man in the shadows waved something green and glistening , and the waft of entrails touched the cat 's sensitive nostrils and made it sit up and watch the stranger .
Hazel crouched down by Blackberry and laid his nostrils close to Bigwig 's , but a light breeze was blowing and he could not tell whether there was breath or not .
The fourteen-year-old stuck the gun up my nostril to see if it would fit .
Bella has a distinctive heart shaped star on her forehead and an ` Isle of Man " snip running down her nose and into the topside of her right nostril .
To have wide flaring nostrils to sniff out those stinkwaves .
Hollow out the nostrils with the Â½in gouge .
I moved to the head and opened the nostril with finger and thumb , revealing a slight muco-purulent discharge .
A film of golden strands covered her mouth and nostrils .
You simply have to be there and open your eyes , ears and nostrils .
Three more lids were shut and boxes returned home and finally a large pinch of the selected substance was taken to the right nostril , another to the left .
A smell peculiar to that place assailed his nostrils with its pungency .
The stink assailed his nostrils , bringing back memories of that last visit and what it had done for him .
A cool breath of stale dank air assailed his nostrils , but to Grant it smelled sweetly of life and freedom .
Lime and leather assailed her nostrils in a tantalising cloud as he bent his head , and before she could object he pressed his lips lightly on her mouth and stepped back .
Dry herb smells filled his nostrils .
The odour of marzipan filled his nostrils .
His earthy sweetness filled her nostrils .
For example , if one of a group of grazing horses spots what may be a predator , he will raise his head , neck and tail and flare his nostrils .
The woman folded her arms , flared her nostrils .
The meteors that burned out the dinosaurs two hundred million years ago were the gouts of flame and phlegm from Fenna 's nostrils .
When Kalchu pulled it up again there was blood trickling from its nostril .
And suddenly , there it was just below them , the huge billow of orange-red smoke and steam coming from the nostrils of the awesome Gruncher .
A string of mucus hung from her left nostril and clung to the curve of her lipsticked mouth ; the waitresses kept looking across at the table .
Overgrown hair stuffed into a baseball cap , gold stud winking in her left nostril , face unblemished by make-up .
A cat does not want to die with the smell of humanity in his nostrils and the noise of humanity in his delicate peaked ears .
The smell of canvas , dust and size pinched up his nostrils , a heady mysterious smell , sweet and sour at once .
Neville pinched at his nostrils and managed a somewhat sickly grin .
Wilcox fumbled for a cigarette , lit it , and exhaled smoke through his nostrils like an angry dragon .
Zacco drew a long breath through pinched nostrils .
I got out a pack of Old Favourites , lit one and fanned smoke through my nostrils .
He made a loud noise through his cavernous nostrils .
Anthea inhaled sharply , and her nostrils flared .
The rise and fail of her ribs was accompanied by a rasping , bubbling wheeze and at each intake her nostrils flared wildly .
His nostrils flared dangerously but she stood her ground .
A second slave began to ladle stewed meat onto the heaped k'va , and the aroma of the ch'min in which it had been cooked made his nostrils twitch .
